name: Rain-X 600001 Windshield Repair Kit - Quick and Easy Durable Resin Based Windshield Repair Kit for Chips and Cracks, Good for Round Damage Below 1" in Diameter and Cracks Smaller Than 12" in Length
short_description: Stops The Spread of Chips and Cracks - Rain-X Windshield Repair Kit Helps You Minimize The Appearance And Stop The Spread Of Chips And Cracks In Your Windshield.Fit Type: Universal Fit

Easy To Use - Everything You Need Is Included, Takes Only Minutes With Minimal Steps. For Cracks Simply Apply Resin To Crack Then Curing Strips, Move Windshield Into Direct Sunlight And Remove Excess. Good for multiple repairs
Durable Resin Formula - Use Durable Resin To Make Windshields Stronger Than Before, Repairing All Types Of Laminated Windshields Up To First Layer Of Windshield Glass
For Best Results - Repairs Should Be Made As Soon As Possible After The Damage Occurs And Before The Break Has Had A Chance To Be Contaminated By Dirt Or Water
Pro-Tip To Avoid Poor Results - Refrain From Applying Resin Too Quickly, Air Pockets Forming During The Repair Or Repairing On A Contaminated Crack As This May Compromise Your Results
product_description: Rain-X Car Windshield Repair Kit helps you minimize the appearance and stop the spread of chips and cracks in your windshield, helping you save time and money, avoiding a full windshield replacement. Rain-X Windshield Repair Kit is easy to use, and only takes minutes to apply. It removes air from the break, fills it with durable resin and makes it even stronger than before. For best results, repairs should be made as soon as possible after the damage occurs and before the break is contaminated by dirt or water. In addition, avoid the use of glass treatments after the crack has formed and prior to repair. However, glass treatments can be applied one (1) week after repair. The kit works best on round damage not more than one inch in diameter, and cracks not longer than 12 inches. It will not repair damage to more than one layer of glass. Pro-tip to avoid poor results - refrain from applying resin too quickly, air pockets forming during the application or repairing a contaminated crack as this may compromise your results.
